name: Mercure Siena Degli Ulivi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself it`s nice, but ... 1st it`s far from the center , 2nd the service is horrible, the staff is unhelpful. The woman in the front desk make a mistake by giving us the key , and told us another room , after 5 min. of trying to open the wrong door i went down to tell her that we can`t open the door and she laugh at me , obviously thinking that we are so stupid that for a first time we see such a door opening , after that she did`t even say i`m sorry my mistake. So for me - it doesn`t worth it .
reviews.title: poor

reviews.text: This hotel was clean and fresh. The rooms very comfortable and large by European standards. The front desk staff was helpful. The free breakfast was just OK. The internet sucked, the only place the internet worked was in the lobby. The good part about the internet was that the time that you purchased was actual usage and not cumlative.
reviews.title: A very clean Hotel, but seems deserted and isolated.

reviews.text: The kid that worked the bar was less than helpful, he had trouble pouring a beer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is expensive, and poor value for money. The rooms are very nice, but the breakfast and the breakfast service was very poor. The coffee and fruit juice was from a machine, and food wasn't replaced as it was used up. There were only 2 staff on breakfast duty, and they had to be asked to put out more bread, or fill up the drinks machines. The desk staff were not particularly friendly.
reviews.title: poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the price of the hotel, we were amazed there was no internet in the rooms, and that we had to pay for the internet service in the reception - especially as we stayed in another Mercure only a couple of days later in France where the rooms were a third of the price and the internet was available in the rooms and was free.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel buy pity about the poor staff attitude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Staff Need Training

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently spent three nights at the Mercure Siena Hotel Degli Ulivi and used this hotel as a base from which to visit Siena. We found the hotel to be up to the usual Mercure four star standard with the one fault being the unfriendly and unhelpful nature of the male staff on reception. From booking in to checking out we received the impression that it was a problem for the male reception staff to actually deal with customers.
reviews.title: Far from the city centre, poor Internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is too far from the city for tourists and it's either a bus or taxi ride from the station or city to the hotel. We didn't know this at the time of our booking. There is also nothing around it as far as eateries, shopping or attractions. During our stay, there was a business conference during one day and that is what the hotel is probably more suited for. Our first night, we arrived late in the afternoon and our only option for dinner was the hotel's restaurant. We found this to be expensive, had a limited menu and our meal wasn't that nice. The breakfast next morning was adequate, but the service wasn't. On both mornings we encountered problems and there wasn't a staff member anywhere to ask for help. First the coffee and juice machines didn't work. The next morning there was no bread for the toaster, then the toaster didn't work. My husband eventually had to walk into the kitchen to find someone to ask for help. Many times the front desk was unattended and there was never anyone behind the bar. In general, the hotel reception areas were deserted. There was a distinct lack of communication between staff as on checkout, we were asked for payment for our restaurant meal even though we'd paid on the night. The staff member we'd paid was standing beside the consierge when we were asked for payment. Luckily we had a receipt. Our hotel room was nice and clean, however the room was very hot and the walls seemed to be quite thin as we could hear snoring and noises from other guests. We wouldn't stay here again and if you're not there for business, wouldn't recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Isolated location and inattentive staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself was fine (except for the shower which was like standing under a garden hose). Breakfast was really good... however, the service, or lack there of, was the worst we experienced in Italy. We stayed on New Years Eve. We were unaware that the hotel was not really walking distance from the town square. There were big celebrations in the town square that the hotel provided no information about. We asked them to book us a taxi to the town square and there was a hotel shuttle going to and from the hotel to the city they didn't even tell us about.
reviews.title: Disappointing for a Mercure Hotel

reviews.text: We were looking for accomodation for the next night but ended up elsewhere as the hotel made us feel very unwelcome. Very brusque and rude.
reviews.title: Poor service and unhelpful staff.

description: The hotel offers 143 rooms, fully equipped with 4 star amenities. Located on the threshold of the historic city walls, a few minutes from the city centre with its medieval atmosphere and the splendour of the Piazza del Campo. Ideal for business and leisure travellers alike, the hotel features a restaurant serving regional and international cuisine, a bar, a gym with sauna and modern and well equipped conference facilities. 4 suites available, to be booked with the hotel directly.
